programme.title: Naked and Afraid
programme.desc: Two Naked and Afraid superfans are dropped into Guyana's scorching savannah to battle the oppressive heat and relentless insect attacks.

programme.title: Naked And Afraid
programme.desc: A married couple goes from watching the challenge from their couch in Idaho to taking it on in the perilous Philippine jungle. Torrential rain, relentless bugs and deadly boars put their survival skills -- and their marriage to the ultimate test.

programme.title: Naked And Afraid
programme.desc: Two strangers are dropped in one of the most dangerous African locations in the dead heat of summer. Faced with aggressive hippos and charging elephants, they quickly learn their place but must mark their territory if they want to make it.

programme.title: Naked and Afraid
programme.desc: Two survivalists are back for redemption in the Mexican jungle, but torrential downpours, competing survival styles and a machete accident threaten to send them home early again.

programme.title: Naked and Afraid
programme.desc: A powerful earthquake in the jungle rattles a thrill-seeking chef and a competitive hockey mom, but lack of food and severe dehydration leads to a disastrous face-first fall. Later, two superfans are dropped deep in the Amazon rainforest.

programme.title: Naked and Afraid
programme.desc: A biker lady and a taxidermist work their way together in an African hunting ground.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth goes missing as Season 11 begins six months after he and Brennan left their careers behind, but a case with ties to the couple pulls Brennan back into the world of forensic analysis, which brings her into contact with a member of Booth's family and Arastoo Vaziri, who's taken the lead at the Jeffersonian in her absence. Meanwhile, the FBI investigate Booth's disappearance, but one agent's tactics are bad for the team's morale.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth is still missing, but the team learns that Agent Miller has hidden information about his whereabouts and physical state. Meanwhile, a digital forensic scientist helps Angela try to decipher information pertaining to Booth's location and the circumstances of his disappearance; and Arastoo makes a decision that will change his and Cam's personal and professional relationships.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Remains found at a fish farm coincide with Brennan and Booth returning to their jobs at the Jeffersonian and the FBI, respectively, and it's revealed that some of the victim's organs were harvested before he was dumped in the water. Meanwhile, Hodgins urges Angela to exhibit her photographs; Cam deals with her decision to choose work over romance; and Booth finds Aubrey in his old office.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A real-estate agent's remains are discovered in a forest and show signs of being partially devoured by coyote-wolf hybrids, so Brennan solicits help from an older, distinguished forensic anthropologist, who amazes the staff with her decades of experience and surprising knowledge of fantasy football, with which the victim was heavily involved and even linked him to a social-media feud with an NFL star.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A case involving a 200-year-old headless corpse gets some help from Ichabod Crane and FBI agent Abbie Mills, who travel from Sleepy Hollow to claim the body, but wonder what it has to do with a contemporary murder victim. Meanwhile, Brennan and Booth surprise each other with Halloween pranks.

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: The Senator in the Street Sweeper
programme.desc: The body of a U.S. senator is found in a street sweeper by an unusual pair of sanitation workers. Meanwhile, Aubrey pursues a relationship with "squintern" Jessica, but he also secretly digs into her past to make sure there are no skeletons in her closet that could ruin his dreams of a political future.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: An escape artist's body is found in the woods, and it's revealed that he may have had enemies in the magic community. Meanwhile, Brennan and Booth ask their friends to opine on their tooth-fairy debate; and Angela continues to work on her photography with Sebastian Kohl.

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: High Treason in the Holiday Season
programme.desc: A political journalist is found dead after writing an article exposing corruption at the NSA, and Hodgins becomes paranoid when he's convinced their investigation is being closely monitored. Meanwhile, the team gathers for Thanksgiving; and Brennan plans a surprise for Booth.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan and Booth go undercover at an Old West-theme shooting competition. Meanwhile, Angela and Hodgins discuss their future and what it holds for their family; and Cam gets to know Sebastian better.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The investigation of a murdered police officer gets some help from a behavioral analyst. Meanwhile, Cam faces some difficult decisions in her personal life.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Hodgins' rehab continues eight weeks after the explosion that left him paralyzed, but he's not quite ready to accept spending the rest of his life in a wheelchair. Meanwhile, Brennan and Booth investigate the death of a public defender whose long list of clients reveals plenty of murder suspects.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A body found in a car crash is identified as a leader of an organization that promotes men's rights, but the investigation leads to an intense clash between Brennan and the deceased's cofounder. Meanwhile, Hodgins' bitterness creates dilemmas for Angela and the staff; and Booth thinks his wife is a jinx for his beloved Philadelphia Flyers hockey team.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A social worker's remains are found, but evidence suggests the victim had been dead for months before the body was dumped in a park, and the case gets even more twisted when it's linked to a serial killer known for desecrating corpses. Meanwhile, Booth and Aubrey hope a behavioral analyst can provide some clues about the murderer; and Cam tries to sort out her romantic life.

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: The Last Shot at a Second Chance
programme.desc: The murder of an ex-con who was living in a halfway house, but vanished, is investigated, and a suspect is linked to Booth. Meanwhile, Brennan is called to testify about her assault of an unarmed individual during a past case, which could result in a suspension; Aubrey and Jessica miss another chance for a first kiss; and the rift widens between Hodgins and Angela.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A private investigator's body is found frozen in ice after being thrown in the Potomac, and the investigation reveals that the victim was a fixer who had a long list of enemies. Meanwhile, Aubrey learns shocking information about his father; Brennan and Booth get Christine's first report card; and Karen Delfs asks Aubrey if he wants to go on a date.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A body found in a rat lab at Lynwood University turns out to be the head of a male a cappella group who recently ejected one of their best singers. Meanwhile, Booth hopes to go on a summer vacation with Parker; a new intern joins the Jeffersonian; and Aubrey's college experience becomes a topic of interest.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A Secret Service agent's body is discovered by an inebriated college student on the eve of a presidential visit, but Booth is blindsided when the agency refuses his help with the case. Meanwhile, Brennan won't let the flu keep her from work even though Dr. Colin Fisher has returned to the Jeffersonian to lead the investigation; and Hodgins attempts a risky experiment to change his life.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: As part of a promotion for the Jeffersonian's Medico-Legal lab, a film crew follows the team as they investigate a murder case involving a corpse buried in a landfill more than 10 years ago, and each member provides commentary in their fields of expertise.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A corpse at a glass recycling plant has a diamond stuck in its jaw, and Inspector Rousseau suspects a descendant of French nobilityâ€”who turns out to be the victim's husbandâ€”may have had something to do with the murder. Meanwhile, Booth learns he has an eye ailment; and Hodgins thinks a ghost is following him.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: In the Season 11 finale, the search for the Puppeteer, a serial killer who turns his victims into marionettes, continues, but Brennan can't shake her guilt of failing to catch the perpetrator due to her brief period of retirement.

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: The Final Chapter: The Hope in the Horror
programme.desc: In the Season 12 premiere, the team searches for Brennan, who was kidnapped by former intern Zack Addy.

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: The Final Chapter: The Brain in the Bot
programme.desc: A body is identified as a man who helped manufacture artificial-intelligence bots, and the team wonders if his own creation had something to do with his death. Meanwhile, Brennan plans her own surprise for everyone on her 40th birthday.

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: The Final Chapter: The Day in the Life
programme.desc: News of Kovac's escape sends Booth scurrying to protect himself and those closest to him from the killer's most dangerous plan to date. Meanwhile, Brennan testifies on Zach's behalf at his trial; and Aubrey and Jessica come to terms about their future together.

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: The Final Chapter: The End in the End
programme.desc: In the series finale, Kovac is still on the loose as the team look for evidence to track him down, but they'll have to do it without Brennan after she experiences a setback, and their task isn't made any easier when it appears he's got outside help and a hideout. Series star David Boreanaz directs.

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: The Final Chapter: The New Tricks in the Old Dogs
programme.desc: Drama at a retirement home ensues when an elderly man's body is found in an acid dump site, and conversation at the lab turns to discussions of marriage and children.

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: The Final Chapter: The Price for the Past
programme.desc: Aubrey's dad resurfaces and immediately presents a moral dilemma for him. Meanwhile, the murder of someone from Booth and Brennan's past is investigated.

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: The Final Chapter: The Tutor in the Tussle
programme.desc: The murder of a tutor of well-to-do students turns up a long list of possible suspects, including unhappy parents and a roommate with a criminal history. Meanwhile, Brennan thinks she'd be a better voice for her audio book than the one chosen for her.

programme.title: Bones
programme.sub-title: The Final Chapter: The Flaw in the Saw

programme.title: Bones

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: R&B singer Brian McKnight serenades the Sharks as part of a pitch by a San Diego DJ who has an idea for a syndicated radio show specializing in love-song dedications. Other products include a skateboard that glides in water; QR code-scanning technology for smartphones; and an easy way to patch holes in window and door screens. Also: an update on a belt with no holes that Daymond invested in during Season 4.

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: The Sharks hear a pitch for hypergravity-exercise clothing, as well as a line of products that appeal to fans of facial hair, and a karaoke machine that adds jaw-dropping vocal harmonies to help users sound like their favorite singing stars. Also: belts that are easy for kids to use; and a follow-up on Barbara's Season 5 investment in a company specializing in hand-knitted socks and leg warmers.

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: A college student from Las Vegas wants to help others improve their SAT scores; exercise enthusiasts from Jenison, Mich., have invented what they believe is the perfect sports bra; two Denver millennials have a high-tech backpack company to pitch to the Sharks; and a serial entrepreneur and his two business partners have a lot riding on a cooling appliance for outdoor use. Also: an update on Chapul Cricket Bars, which Mark Cuban invested in during Season 5.

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: A young man who applied four times to be on "Shark Tank" finally gets his chance when he pitches a gimmicky business that delivers an unusual twist to a common vegetable; a barbecue sauce receives high praise; two millennial entrepreneurs take some of the hassle out of luggage and packing when traveling; and a biochemist from Chapel Hill, N.C., comes up with a device to ensure protection from the sun. Also: an update on Barbara Corcoran's Season 5 investment in the Grace and Lace accessory line.

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Bethenny Frankel sits in with the Sharks. Inventions include a line of teas laced with attitude; a solution for a hairy problem; a product to keep babies safe and mess-free during diaper changes; and a technology that can improve sleep and reduce stress.

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: A family of entrepreneurs from Chapin, S.C., and Fairhope, Ala., present a product that satisfies a unique obsession; a husband and wife from Englewood, N.J., introduce a subscription service that makes meal time for kids stress-free for parents; an entrepreneur from Yorba Linda, Cal., pitches a Bollywood-inspired dance fitness program; and a husband and wife from Dallas give the Sharks a taste of their better-tasting probiotic beverage.

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: A Malaysian immigrant starts her therapy lamp business at Minneapolis, Minn. Entrepreneurs introduce their portable oxygen in a can.

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: A husband and wife from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, wow the sharks with the biggest product ever brought to the tank...life sized, scientifically accurate animatronic dinosaurs! An entrepreneur from Buna, Texas, shocks the sharks with the big sales of her humble beverage coolers.

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: An Illinois perfume peddler; a San Francisco woman selling luxury soap; an Alabama guitar teacher who says his learning system is unique; a "Mr. Mom" from Baton Rouge, La., with accessories for blue jeans. Also: an update on a gourmet seafood business from Season 2.

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: One product has the men competing against the women. programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: The Sharks hear pitches appropriate for the holiday season; two Philadelphia women demonstrate their all-natural deodorant made from activated charcoal; and Daymond John holds a workshop featuring special guest chef Rocco DiSpirito. programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Alex Rodriguez sits in with the Sharks as Rob Gronkowski and his brothers pitch an insulated sports bottle to the group. Other pitches include a tool to soothe foot pain; a sweeter way to eat a popular snack; and an inventive way to keep belongings safe.

programme.desc: Scott goes to Vegas, and Kourtney is afraid that he'll be lured back to his old lifestyle; Kylie and Kendall think Kris is meddling in their lives.

programme.title: Las Vegas
programme.desc: Danny and Mike probe serial robberies in the casino's residential suites and also find time to serve as models for a charity beefcake calendar. Meanwhile, Jillian (Cheryl Ladd) is alarmed when she discovers her marriage to Ed may have adversely affected Delinda. Robert Wagner guest stars, along with Hal Sparks and Brooke Burke.

programme.title: Las Vegas
programme.sub-title: All Quiet on the Montecito Front
programme.desc: Romance begins to bloom between Danny and Delinda, to their utmost surprise. But keeping the relationship tight-lipped proves difficult, particularly when Jillian (Cheryl Ladd) flies in Delinda's old college flame (Shawn Christian). Meanwhile, Casey (Dean Cain) organizes a paintball retreat for the department heads.

programme.title: Las Vegas
programme.desc: Jillian (Cheryl Ladd) and Ed try to go on a peaceful retreat, but the trip is anything but relaxing. Meanwhile, Danny and Mike scrutinize a deep-pocketed gambler wagering million-dollar bets; and romance heats up between Delinda and a former flame (Shawn Christian).

programme.title: Las Vegas
programme.desc: Delinda answers Dr. Derek's marriage proposal. Meanwhile, a couple of high rollers suspect their spouses are cheating, so Danny and Mike investigate; and Sam and Woody (Jerry O'Connell) depart for a romantic getaway. Olympic figure skater Sasha Cohen makes a guest appearance. Dr. Derek: Shawn Christian.

programme.title: Las Vegas
programme.desc: Old romances---and simmering conflicts---resurface as one of the ladies prepares for her nuptials. Meanwhile, Ed's CIA past comes back to haunt him, threatening his life. Dean Cain, Jerry O'Connell and Shawn Christian guest star, and Wolfgang Puck also makes an appearance. Kristian Bush and Jennifer Nettles, of the country-pop trio Sugarland, perform.

programme.title: Las Vegas
programme.desc: The Montecito crew is shocked when a gunman attacks Big Ed. Meanwhile, Delinda makes an emotional disclosure about her romantic feelings for Danny, much to her fiancÃ©'s chagrin; and Sam journeys to Hawaii to tackle a whale of a problem. Kelly Hu guest stars, and musician Jewel makes an appearance. Derek: Shawn Christian.

programme.title: Las Vegas
programme.desc: Secrets about Ed's mysterious past come to light when he returns from a shadowy Moroccan trip. Meanwhile, sparks fly between Danny and Delinda; and Mike travels to Hawaii to help Sam deal with her problems.

programme.title: Las Vegas
programme.desc: When three of Sam's clients stiff the Montecito for more than $500,000, the casino hires a no-nonsense professional collector (James Russo) to "visit" the debtors. Meanwhile, Danny and Delinda's relationship heats up as they discuss moving in together; Ed helps a spineless hubby get some backbone; and Mary tries to conquer her biggest fear with help from Adam Carolla (who plays himself). Don: David Burke. Becky: Stephanie Brown.

programme.title: Las Vegas
programme.desc: Jill Hennessy and Jerry O'Connell appear as their "Crossing Jordan" characters, who journey to Sin City to find the killer of an acclaimed violinist while also searching for the victim's missing $3 million Stradivarius violin. Another valuable item goes missing when the Montecito's safe-deposit vault is robbed of a Super Bowl ring belonging to Lawrence Taylor (who appears as himself). Meanwhile, Danny and Delinda try to delicately inform Ed that they're moving in together.

programme.title: Las Vegas
programme.desc: Part 1 of 2. With only 12 hours to rescue Delinda from kidnappers, Ed scurries to pilfer $50 million from the Montecito as ransom money. Meanwhile, Mike and Sam scrutinize a Buddhist monk's winning streak; and the casino is plagued by a flu epidemic.

programme.title: Las Vegas
programme.desc: Conclusion. Ed continues his desperate efforts to rescue Delinda from kidnappers. Meanwhile, Mike and Sam scrutinize a Buddhist monk's winning streak.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, And Dives

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives

programme.title: Belfast

As the tension between these two opposing forces escalates, he and his family must decide whether to stay, or move somewhere safe.

programme.desc: Bob's dream of becoming an outdoorsman is in sight when he learns a nearby wildness-equipment store is having a going-out-of-business sale, and his newfound expertise is put to the test when he gets locked overnight in the store. programme.title: Bob's Burgers

programme.sub-title: Sit Me Baby One More Time
